title: The day Russia adopted the free market
description: In the early 90s, American economist Jeffrey Sachs was a part of a team that tried to transform Russia's economy. It did not go as planned. He tells us what he thinks went so wrong. | Subscribe to our weekly newsletter here.
copyright: Copyright 2015-2021 NPR - For Personal Use Only

itunes:summary: Jeffrey Sachs explains why he thinks "shock therapy" was so tough in Russia
